description: Details submitted pursuant to Condition 18 (Landscaping) of permission 00505/P/P73 dated 13.03.2009 for the retention and alteration (including limited, selective demolition) of Wallis House in association with the re-instatement of employment use (Class B1- business), the creation of a gallery (Class D1- non residential institutions), the provision of a health club (Class D2- assembly and leisure) and the introduction of residential use (Class C3-dwellinghouses) of the building. The retention, alteration and extension of InternationalHouse and its use as a restaurant (Class A3- restaurant and cafes) and incubator business units (Class B1- business). The demolition of all other buildings on the site and redevelopment for mixed employment (Class A1-shops, A2- financial and professional services, A3- restaurants and cafes, A4- drinking establishments, B1- business and C1- hotels), community (Class D1- non- residential institutions and D2- assembly and leisure) and private and affordable residential (Class C3- dwellinghouses) use, together with associated public and private open spaces, access roads, service areas, 1,045 car parking and landscaping. The proposed buildings range from 4 to 10 storeys in height and a 25- storey
